from __future__ import absolute_import
from __future__ import division
from __future__ import print_function
from __future__ import unicode_literals

import re

from havoc.autotest_testfiles.validation_utils.lib.autoval_exceptions import TestError
from havoc.lib.filesystem_actions import FilesystemActions
from havoc.autoval.lib.host.openbmc import OpenBMC
from havoc.autotest_testfiles.validation_utils.lib.autoval import AutovalUtils
from havoc.autoval.lib.host.sshpass import SSHPassConn
from havoc.lib.decorators import retry
from havoc.autoval.lib.host.credentials import Credentials



[docs]class OpenBMCBryceCanyon(OpenBMC):


[docs]    def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs):
        self.fs_actions = FilesystemActions()
        self.check_usb0 = True
        super(OpenBMCBryceCanyon, self).__init__(*args, **kwargs)
        self.config_filter = {
            "enclosure_err": [
                r"\(No Error\)",
                r"BMC CPU Utilization too high",
                r"Server sensor health is bad",
                r"Error Counter: \d{1,2}",
                r"Error Code\s\w{1,2}:"
            ]
        }



[docs]    def health_check(self):
        # Determine if it's a OpenBMC Triton/BryceCanyon
        search_pattern = ["Triton", "BryceCanyon"]
        for model in search_pattern:
            is_openbmcbrycecanyon = self.detect_openbmc_model(model)
            if is_openbmcbrycecanyon:
                break
        if not is_openbmcbrycecanyon:
            raise Exception("No OpenBMC Bryce Canyon device detected")
        else:
            AutovalUtils.log_info("Detected server Bryce Canyon")



[docs]    def get_critical_services(self):
        '''
        This method returns a list of services that are always expected to
        run on the openBMC BryceCanyon System
        '''
        return ['sensord', 'healthd', 'fscd']


    # OEM Related

[docs]    def clear_boot_order_cmos(self):
        #cmd = "/usr/local/bin/bios-util server  --boot_order enable --clear_CMOS"
        #self.bmc_host.run(cmd)
        super(OpenBMCBryceCanyon, self).clear_boot_order_cmos("server")
        self.power_reset()



[docs]    def parse_ecc_errors(self, log):
        """
        Check ecc value for checking openbmc current health
        Report any correctable or uncorrectable error logged on the BMC
        as Failure. This check will let us monitor the correctable
        uncorrectable errors

        @param {} log: contains correctable ECC and uncorrectable ECC
        """
        correctable_ecc = log[5:7]
        uncorrectable_ecc = log[7:8]
        if correctable_ecc != "00" or uncorrectable_ecc != "0":
            raise TestError(
                "Correctable_ecc - %s \n Uncorrectable_ecc - %s" %
                (correctable_ecc, uncorrectable_ecc)
            )



[docs]    def parse_enclosure_error(self, log):
        """
        Enclosure error check.

        @param String log: enclosure errors output
        """
        if log:
            raise TestError("Stopping test due to enclosure error(s): {}".format(log))



[docs]    def get_slot_info(self):
        return "server"



[docs]    def get_fru_no(self):
        # Monolake servers FRU is 1 by default
        return "1"


    # @Override OpenBMC

[docs]    def get_config(
        self,
        log_dir,
        test_start_time,
        start=True,
        bios_dump_filter=None
    ):
        config_dict = super(OpenBMCBryceCanyon, self).get_config(
            log_dir,
            test_start_time,
            start=start,
            bios_dump_filter=bios_dump_filter
        )
        self.parse_ecc_errors(self.get_ecc())
        self.parse_enclosure_error(config_dict['enclosure_err'])

        return config_dict


    # @Override OpenBMC

[docs]    def get_config_details(
        self,
        log_dir,
        test_start_time,
        start=True,
        bios_dump_filter=None,
    ):
        config_dict = super(OpenBMCBryceCanyon, self).get_config_details(
            log_dir, test_start_time, start=start, bios_dump_filter=bios_dump_filter
        )
        config_dict['enclosure_err'] = self.get_enclosure_util_error()

        return config_dict



[docs]    def get_ecc(self):
        # check for correctable and uncorrectable ecc
        cmd = "/sbin/devmem 0x1e6e0050"
        return self.bmc_host.run(cmd)



[docs]    def openbmc_flashcp_upgrade_cmd(self, subfile):
        cmd = "/usr/sbin/"
        cmd += "flashcp -v /tmp/%s /dev/mtd5" % subfile
        AutovalUtils.log_info("Executing OpenBMC %s" % (cmd))
        out = self.bmc_host.run(cmd)
        return out



[docs]    def verify_flash_sensors(self, out):
        out = out.splitlines()
        for line in out:
            match = re.search(r".*?SMART\w*", line)
            if match:
                status = re.search(r'\(ok\)', line)
                if status:
                    continue
                else:
                    out.remove(line)
        out = ''.join(out)
        return out



[docs]    def openbmc_flashcp_prerequisite(self):
        return



[docs]    def bios_post_flash(self, current_reboot):
        self.host.system_health_check(current_reboot, 1200)
        if not self.check_powered_on():
            self.power_on()



[docs]    def validate_fan_speed(self, percentage_got, percentage_given_byuser):
        if (int(percentage_given_byuser) == percentage_got):
            AutovalUtils.log_info(
                "Percentage successfully set to desired value"
            )
        else:
            raise TestError("Failed to set fan speed to desired value")



[docs]    def scc_sensor_data(self):
        AutovalUtils.log_info("sensor-util scc")
        cmd = "/usr/local/bin/"
        cmd += "sensor-util scc"

        out = self.bmc_host.run(cmd)
        return out

[docs]    def iom_scc_dpb_sensor(self):
        out = self.iom_sensor_data()
        out += "\n" + self.scc_sensor_data()
        out += "\n" + self.dpb_sensor_data()
        return out

        base = super(OpenBMCBryceCanyon, self).get_full_fruid_list()
        base += "\n" + self.iom_scc_dpb_fruid()
        return base

        base += "\n" + self.iom_scc_dpb_sensor()
        return base

        cmd = "/usr/local/bin/"
        cmd += "log-util iom --print"
        out = self.bmc_host.run(cmd)
        return out

        return out

[docs]    def log_util_all_options(self):
        logs = super(OpenBMCBryceCanyon, self).log_util_all_options()
        logs.append(self.log_util_iom())
        logs.append(self.log_util_dpb())
        logs.append(self.log_util_scc())
        return logs



[docs]    def get_enclosure_util_error(self):
        cmd = "/usr/bin/enclosure-util --error"
        return self.bmc_host.run(cmd)



[docs]    def bc_ac_cycle(self, timeout=1200):
        current_reboot = self.bmc_host.get_last_reboot()

        cmd = "/usr/sbin/i2cset -y 6 0x10 0xd9 c"
        AutovalUtils.log_info("Ac cycling now: %s" % (cmd))
        try:
            self.bmc_host.run(cmd)
        except Exception:
            AutovalUtils.log_info("Waiting for the host to reconnect")

        self.host.system_health_check(current_reboot, timeout)
        self.post_cycle_check()



[docs]    @retry(tries=6, sleep_seconds=3, exponential=True)
    def fw_util_scc(self):
        cmd = "/usr/bin/fw-util scc --version"
        out = self.bmc_host.run(cmd)
        return out



[docs]    def get_fw_util_options(self):
        base = super(OpenBMCBryceCanyon, self).fw_util_bmc_nic_slot()
        base += "\n" + self.fw_util_scc()
        return base



[docs]    def fw_update_bmc(self, file_path, reboot=True):
        cmd = "/bin/cat /etc/issue"
        out = self.bmc_host.run(cmd)
        match = re.search(r"\d+\.\d+", out).group(0)
        if float(match) >= 1.6:
            cmd = "/usr/bin/fw-util bmc --update --bmc %s" % (file_path)
            AutovalUtils.log_info("Executing OpenBMC %s" % (cmd))
            out = self.bmc_host.run(cmd, timeout=600)
            if reboot:
                self.reboot()
        else:
            cmd = "/usr/bin/fw-util iom --update --bmc %s" % (file_path)
            AutovalUtils.log_info("Executing OpenBMC %s" % (cmd))
            out = self.bmc_host.run(cmd, timeout=600)
        return out



[docs]    def fw_update_rom(self, file_path, reboot=True):
        cmd = "/bin/cat /etc/issue"
        out = self.bmc_host.run(cmd)
        match = re.search(r"\d+\.\d+", out).group(0)
        if float(match) >= 1.6:
            cmd = "/usr/bin/fw-util bmc --update --rom %s" % (file_path)
            AutovalUtils.log_info("Executing OpenBMC %s" % (cmd))
            out = self.bmc_host.run(cmd, timeout=600)
            if reboot:
                self.reboot()
        else:
            cmd = "/usr/bin/fw-util iom --update --rom %s" % (file_path)
            AutovalUtils.log_info("Executing OpenBMC %s" % (cmd))
            out = self.bmc_host.run(cmd, timeout=600)
        return out



[docs]    def validate_version(self, fw_ver_num):
        # Validate the version to be updated
        # If version > 1.0, then use fw-util command
        # else use flashcp method
        match = map(float, re.findall(r"\d+\.\d+", fw_ver_num))
        for match_string in match:
            if match_string >= 1.0:
                return True
            else:
                return False



[docs]    def post_cycle_check(self, filter_errors=None):
        self.validate_vboot_util(filter_errors)



[docs]    def restart_usb0_interface(self):
        self.host.run("ifconfig usb0 down")
        self.host.run("ifconfig usb0 up")



[docs]    @retry(tries=3, sleep_seconds=5)
    def usb0_access_check(self):
        (user_id, passwd) = Credentials().get_openbmc_credentials(self.host.hostname)
        bmc_host = SSHPassConn(
            host=self.get_usb0_ip(),
            source_host=self.host.connection,
            user=user_id,
            password=passwd
        )
        cmd = "/usr/bin/uptime"
        bmc_host.run(cmd)



[docs]    def bmc_health_check(self, last_reboot=None):
        super(OpenBMCBryceCanyon, self).bmc_health_check(last_reboot)
        if self.check_usb0:
            self.usb0_access_check()
        else:
            return



[docs]    def reboot(self, timeout=600, filter_errors=None):
        self.check_usb0 = False
        super(OpenBMCBryceCanyon, self).reboot(
            timeout, filter_errors
        )
        self.check_usb0 = True



[docs]    def forced_bmc_reset(self):
        self.check_usb0 = False
        super(OpenBMCBryceCanyon, self).forced_bmc_reset()
        self.check_usb0 = True



[docs]    def force_reboot(self, timeout=600, filter_errors=None):
        self.check_usb0 = False
        super(OpenBMCBryceCanyon, self).force_reboot(
            timeout, filter_errors
        )
        self.check_usb0 = True
